comment: Most of the readings in his class take hours at a time because they are obnoxiously long and the language is so academic, so most people don't do the readings which makes group discussions annoying. He makes students uncomfortable because he doesn't seem to understand personal space. Also he tries to act cool but his "humor" isn't always PC...

I honestly can't say enough good things about Charlie. I've taken him for three of my theatre classes. He always says "education should never be an emergency" and he means that. If ur having difficulties inside or outside of class he is there for you. He honesty want to know your opinion on topics in class and if u participate ur sure to get an A!
Honestly the best professor I've ever had. If you are sincere with him and work hard, he will go way out of his way to help you grow as an artist.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He's an engaging speaker, but the assignments he gives have very little to do with his lectures. The parameters of his assignments are vaguely worded, yet he grades them according to very specific standards. Also, with the exception of the main presentation, he never teaches students HOW to do the things he's asking for.

comment: I've had Charlie for multiple classes. He keeps it interesting. Also, he's not bad to look at. Super sweet guy. He wants his students to succeed, so if you try just a little, you will.
